expression_430.primary: I don't know off the top of my head.
similar: I'd have to check my notes.
I don't have that info on hand.
expression_430.example:
A: Do you remember the address of that new spot in Queens?
B: Honestly? I don't know off the top of my head. Let me check my phone.
A: No rush. I just wanted to see if it was close to the train.
B: Found it! It's right on 31st Ave.
A: Perfect. That's super easy to get to.
B: Facts. We should definitely go this weekend.

expression_431.example:
A: Why are you looking so stressed out today?
B: It's these constant train delays. I'm honestly fed up with it.
A: I feel you. The MTA has been a nightmare lately.
B: For real. I've been late to work three times this week.
A: Maybe it's time to start biking or something.
B: Facts. At least then I'm in control of the timing.

expression_432.primary: I've got a lot on my plate.
expression_432.example:
A: You coming through to the basketball game tonight?
B: I wish! But I've got a lot on my plate with these finals coming up.
A: Damn, I forgot you were in grad school too.
B: Yeah, it's a lot to handle all at once.
A: Respect. I'll catch you after you pass all those tests.
B: Bet. I'll definitely need a drink then.

similar: I have no sense of direction.
I can't find my way anywhere.
expression_433.example:
A: Just meet me at the corner of 5th and 14th.
B: You know I'm bad with directions, right? Can you just send me your location?
A: Haha, my bad. I forgot you're basically helpless without GPS.
B: It's not funny! I'll end up in the wrong borough by accident.
A: Sent. Just follow the blue dot, okay?
B: On my way. Don't leave without me!

expression_434.example:
A: I heard about the breakup. How are you holding up?
B: It's been tough, but I'm trying to stay busy.
A: That's probably for the best. Let me know if you wanna vent.
B: Thanks, I really appreciate it. Friends like you are a lifesaver.
A: Any time. Let's grab some food tomorrow, my treat.
B: Sounds like a plan. I could definitely use a distraction.

expression_435.primary: All you have to do is do it.
expression_435.example:
A: I really want to start my own YouTube channel but I'm scared.
B: Honestly? All you have to do is do it. Stop planning and just record something.
A: But what if it's not perfect right away?
B: No one's first video is perfect. You learn as you go.
A: You're right. I'm just gonna pick up the camera today.
B: That's the spirit. Start small and grow from there.

expression_436.primary: What do you have in mind?
expression_436.example:
A: We should definitely do something fun for your birthday.
B: I'm down. What do you have in mind? I'm open to anything.
A: I was thinking we could do a rooftop dinner or something.
B: Ooh, that sounds classy. Which spot were you thinking?
A: There's this new place in Williamsburg with a crazy view.
B: Say less. I'm already there in my head.

expression_437.example:
A: I'm not going to the party if she's gonna be there.
B: Come on, don't be that way! It's my birthday, just ignore her.
A: You know she always tries to start drama with me.
B: I'll make sure she stays on the other side of the room.
A: Fine, I'll go, but if she says one thing to me, I'm out.
B: Deal. I'm just glad you're coming.

expression_438.example:
A: We've been planning this launch for months.
B: For real. It's finally time to get the ball rolling.
A: Everyone knows their roles, right?
B: Yeah, we're all set. Let's just execute.
A: Perfect. I'll send out the first batch of emails now.
B: Let's do it. Onwards and upwards!

expression_439.primary: It costs an arm and a leg.
expression_439.example:
A: Did you see those new designer shoes at the mall?
B: Yeah, but honestly? It costs an arm and a leg just to look at them.
A: No cap. I love the style, but I have bills to pay.
B: Exactly. I could buy like ten pairs of regular sneakers for that price.
A: Facts. Some things just aren't worth the hype.
B: Definitely. I'll stick to my thrift store finds.

expression_440.example:
A: I'm just trying to finish this task as fast as possible.
B: Look, don't just go through the motions. Quality actually matters here.
A: I know, I'm just feeling a bit burnt out today.
B: Take a break then. It's better to do it right than to do it twice.
A: You're right. I'll step away for a bit and come back refocus.
B: Smart move. Do it right, and you won't have to worry about it later.

expression_441.primary: You took the words right out of my mouth.
similar: That's exactly what I was thinking.
I was about to say that.
expression_441.example:
A: This coffee shop is way too loud to get any work done.
B: Seriously! You took the words right out of my mouth.
A: Let's just head over to the library instead.
B: I'm down. It's much quieter over there anyway.
A: Facts. Let's pack up our stuff and go.
B: Say less. I'm already out the door.

expression_442.example:
A: I was just joking about your new haircut, chill out.
B: Honestly? You crossed the line when you brought up my insecurities.
A: My bad, I didn't realize it would bother you that much.
B: Some things just aren't funny, man. You gotta know the limit.
A: You're right. I'm really sorry. I didn't mean any harm.
B: I appreciate the apology. Let's just not go there again.

similar: He really knows what he's talking about.
expression_443.example:
A: Should I ask the new guy for help with the coding issue?
B: Definitely. He really knows his stuff when it comes to React.
A: That's good to hear. I was struggling with this component for hours.
B: He'll probably fix it in like five minutes. He's a wizard.
A: Alright, I'll go hit him up now.
B: Good luck. Let me know what he says.

expression_444.example:
A: This week has been such a struggle at work.
B: I know it's tough, but hang in there! Only two more days till the weekend.
A: I'm honestly just counting down the hours at this point.
B: You've got this. Keep your head up and push through.
A: Thanks for the encouragement. It really helps during these long shifts.
B: Any time. You're almost there!

expression_445.primary: You need to break the habit.
expression_445.example:
A: I keep checking my phone every five minutes without even thinking.
B: You really need to break that habit. It's killing your focus.
A: I know, but it feels like an addiction at this point.
B: Try leaving it in another room while you're working.
A: That's a good idea. I'll give it a shot today.
B: Trust me, you'll feel way more productive.

expression_446.primary: You hit the nail on the head.
expression_446.example:
A: I think the real reason we're losing customers is the checkout process.
B: Wow, you really hit the nail on the head. That's exactly where the drop-off happens.
A: It's just too complicated and takes too many steps.
B: Facts. We need to streamline it as much as possible.
A: Let's start working on a simpler design today.
B: I'm all for it. That should definitely boost our numbers.

expression_447.primary: My brain is not as good as it used to be.
similar: I'm not as sharp as before.
I feel a bit rusty lately.
expression_447.example:
A: Do you remember the name of that movie we watched last night?
B: Honestly? My brain is not as good as it used to be. I already forgot.
A: Haha, it was 'Inception'! How could you forget that?
B: I don't know, man. Lately I just can't keep names straight.
A: It's all good. Maybe you just need some more sleep.
B: Facts. I'm definitely feeling a bit sluggish.

expression_448.example:
A: How much did you pay for that bottle of water at the concert?
B: Ten bucks. I honestly felt like I was being ripped off.
A: That's highway robbery! They really know people are desperate.
B: For real. I should've just brought my own reusable bottle.
A: Live and learn, I guess. At least you're hydrated now.
B: Facts, but my wallet is definitely feeling lighter.

expression_449.primary: You've got to bite the bullet.
similar: Just do it even if it's hard.
expression_449.example:
A: I really don't want to tell my boss about the mistake I made.
B: Look, you've got to bite the bullet and just be honest about it.
A: It's gonna be such an awkward conversation though.
B: It'll be worse if they find out from someone else later.
A: You're right. I'll just go in there and get it over with.
B: Smart move. Integrity is always the best path.

expression_450.primary: I can't get that off my mind.
similar: It's all I can think about.
expression_450.example:
A: You've been staring at that same page for twenty minutes.
B: I know. I just can't get that conversation we had earlier off my mind.
A: Was it that bad? I thought we cleared things up.
B: It's not that, it's just a lot to process, you know?
A: I feel you. Just take your time with it.
B: Thanks. I'll try to focus on something else for a bit.

expression_451.example:
A: I think I can finish this whole project in one night.
B: Look, don't kid yourself. You know that's not gonna happen.
A: But I'm feeling really motivated right now!
B: Motivation is great, but physics and time are still real things.
A: Fine, maybe I'll need two nights then.
B: Better. Let's aim for a realistic deadline instead.

similar: It's no walk in the park.
expression_452.example:
A: How was the half-marathon? Was it as fun as you expected?
B: Honestly? It's no picnic. My legs are basically jelly right now.
A: I bet. Twenty-one kilometers is a long way to run.
B: For real. The hills at the end were especially brutal.
A: I'm still proud of you for finishing though!
B: Thanks. I'm definitely taking a break from running for a while.

expression_453.example:
A: I still can't believe he said those mean things to me.
B: Look, it happened weeks ago. You just need to let it go.
A: It's hard though. I really thought he was my friend.
B: Some people aren't worth the energy. Focus on yourself instead.
A: You're right. I'm just wasting my time thinking about him.
B: Exactly. Let's go out and have some fun instead.

expression_454.primary: We all have to pitch in.
expression_454.example:
A: The kitchen is a complete mess after that dinner party.
B: I know. We all have to pitch in if we want to get it clean quickly.
A: I'll handle the dishes if you can take out the trash.
B: Deal. And I'll ask the others to wipe down the counters.
A: Perfect. Many hands make light work, as they say.
B: Facts. We'll be done in no time.

expression_455.example:
A: We've been at this for ten hours. My brain is officially fried.
B: Honestly? Let's call it a day. We can finish this in the morning.
A: I'm all for it. I'm literally seeing spots at this point.
B: Facts. Everyone go home, get some rest, and we'll regroup then.
A: Sounds like a plan. Safe travels everyone!
B: Peace out! See you tomorrow.

expression_456.example:
A: Did you see him throwing a tantrum in the middle of the store?
B: Yeah, it was so embarrassing. Honestly? He needs to act his age.
A: For real. You're thirty-five, not five. Calm down.
B: Some people just never learn how to regulate their emotions.
A: It's honestly just sad to watch.
B: Facts. Maturity is clearly not inherited.

similar: It was too complex for me.
expression_457.example:
A: Did you understand the technical part of the presentation?
B: Not at all. Honestly? Most of it just went over my head.
A: I feel you. Those charts were incredibly confusing.
B: For real. I'm gonna have to ask for a simplified summary later.
A: Same. I don't think anyone in that room actually followed along.
B: Facts. They really need to work on their communication skills.

expression_458.primary: You're barking up the wrong tree.
similar: You're looking for the wrong person/thing.
expression_458.example:
A: I'm pretty sure you were the one who took my sandwich from the fridge.
B: Look, you're barking up the wrong tree. I wasn't even in the office today.
A: Oh... Wait, really? My bad. I just assumed since you usually like turkey.
B: All good, but maybe check with Bob. He was eyeing that sandwich all morning.
A: Smart move. I'll go hit him up.
B: Good luck with your investigations, Detective.

expression_459.example:
A: I can't believe I spilled a tiny bit of coffee on my shirt!
B: Look, it's barely noticeable. Don't make a big deal out of it.
A: But I have an important meeting in twenty minutes!
B: Just dab it with some water, it'll be fine. No one's gonna be staring at your chest.
A: Alright, alright. I'm just overthinking it.
B: Facts. Just focus on your presentation instead.

similar: To make a long story short.
expression_460.example:
A: Can you explain the whole situation with the merger?
B: Well, in a nutshell, we're combining two teams to save on costs.
A: So are there gonna be layoffs then?
B: That's the part we're still figuring out, but hopefully not.
A: I see. Thanks for clarify it so clearly.
B: No problem. I'll keep you posted as I hear more.

expression_461.example:
A: We're throwing a surprise party for him this Friday.
B: Ooh, I love surprises! I'll definitely be there.
A: Just whatever you do, don't spill the beans! He has no idea.
B: My lips are sealed. I'm actually really good at keeping secrets.
A: Good to hear. We want this to be a total shock.
B: Bet. He's gonna be so hyped.

expression_462.example:
A: Yo, the flight just got cancelled. The next one isn't till tomorrow morning.
B: You've got to be kidding me. This can't be happening right now.
A: I wish it was a joke. The whole board is covered in red.
B: We're gonna miss the wedding! This is honestly the worst timing ever.
A: Let's go talk to the gate agent and see if they can rebook us.
B: Facts. I'm literally about to lose my mind.

expression_463.primary: I'm going to keep my eyes peeled.
similar: I'll keep a sharp eye out.
expression_463.example:
A: I lost my keys somewhere near the park. Have you seen them?
B: Haven't seen them yet, but I'm going to keep my eyes peeled for you.
A: Thanks, man. They've got a little green keychain on them.
B: Got it. I'll hit you up as soon as I spot anything.
A: I really appreciate the help. I'm so stressed right now.
B: Chill, we'll find them. Stay positive.

similar: I'm with you all the way.
expression_464.example:
A: I'm finally gonna ask for that promotion this afternoon.
B: Go for it! Honestly, I'm right behind you 100%.
A: Thanks. I'm still a little nervous about how they'll react.
B: You've earned it, so just be confident and state your case.
A: Your support really means a lot to me. Fingers crossed!
B: You'll kill it. Let's celebrate after work either way.

expression_465.example:
A: I'm just saying, maybe if you cleaned up more occasionally...
B: Ugh, there you go again. Can we please just have one meal without an argument?
A: I'm just trying to have a reasonable conversation about the house!
B: Your timing is always the worst though. Let's just eat.
A: Fine, but we're talking about this later tonight.
B: Great. Looking forward to it already.

expression_466.example:
A: Hey, just so you know, they're closing the main road for construction tonight.
B: Oh word? Thanks for the heads up. I'll take the side streets instead.
A: Smart move. It's probably gonna be a total traffic nightmare.
B: For real. You saved me like thirty minutes of sitting in a car.
A: No sweat. Just didn't want you to get stuck.
B: Good looks. See you later tonight!

expression_467.example:
A: It's been great getting to know you this past month!
B: Same here! I'm sad you're moving back to Cali.
A: I know, but don't be a stranger! Hit me up whenever you're in the area.
B: Definitely. You better do the same if you ever come back here.
A: You know it. Safe travels home!
B: Thanks. Peace out for now!

expression_468.example:
A: Are you done with the report yet? How about now? Now?
B: Honestly? Stop bugging me! I told you I'll have it by 5 PM.
A: I just wanted to make sure we're on track.
B: Your constant questions are actually making me slower. Chill out.
A: Alright, alright. I'll leave you alone for now.
B: Thank you. I really need to focus.

similar: I know exactly how you feel.
expression_469.example:
A: I feel so embarrassed for tripping in front of everyone.
B: Don't even worry about it. I've been there before, trust me.
A: Everyone probably thinks I'm such a klutz now.
B: In three minutes, they'll have forgotten all about it. Stay chill.
A: I hope so. It was just so public, you know?
B: Facts. But honestly, most people are too busy with their own stuff to care.

expression_470.primary: We're working with a skeleton crew.
similar: Only a few people are here.
expression_470.example:
A: Why is service taking so long at the restaurant today?
B: Honestly? We're working with a skeleton crew because of the flu going around.
A: Oh, that makes sense. I apologize for being impatient.
B: No worries. We're doing our best with what we've got.
A: I'll just be patient then. I'm in no rush anyway.
B: I appreciate the understanding. Your food should be out soon.

expression_471.example:
A: Why don't we just use the new software for the project?
B: That's the thing... it's not compatible with our current systems.
A: Oh... I didn't realize that was an issue.
B: Yeah, we'd have to upgrade everything, which costs a fortune.
A: Well, that's a huge hurdle then.
B: Facts. We're gonna have to stick with the old way for now.

expression_472.primary: It's no wonder you think that.
similar: It makes sense you feel that way.
I see why you'd assume that.
expression_472.example:
A: I'm really skeptical about this new company policy.
B: Honestly? It's no wonder you think that after everything that happened last year.
A: Exactly. They've broken our trust way too many times.
B: For real. It's gonna take a while before anyone actually believes them again.
A: Facts. I'm just gonna wait and see what they actually do.
B: Smart move. Actions speak louder than corporate emails.

expression_473.example:
A: My phone just ran out of battery right when I needed it most.
B: Don't even stress. It happens all the time to the best of us.
A: It's just so frustrating! I was in the middle of a call.
B: Next time just keep a portable charger with you. Game changer.
A: You're right. I'm just gonna go plug it in now.
B: Better late than never. I'll wait for you to come back online.

similar: Nothing that proves it for sure.
expression_474.example:
A: I'm pretty sure he stole the idea, but I can't prove it.
B: That's the problem. There is no smoking gun, so it's your word against his.
A: It's so frustrating! I know it's my concept.
B: I believe you, but without some kind of paper trail, it's tough.
A: I'll start keeping better notes and records from now on.
B: Smart move. Protect yourself for next time.

expression_475.example:
A: Why are you being so quiet? Are you still mad about the game?
B: Honestly? Yeah, I'm salty because we should've won that one easily.
A: It was a close game, though! You played really well.
B: That doesn't matter if we didn't get the W. Let's just go home.
A: Alright, alright. Don't be such a sore loser.
B: Whatever. I'll be over it tomorrow morning.

similar: Believe me, you don't wanna hear it.
expression_476.example:
A: How was your meeting with the scary boss today?
B: Look, you don't even want to know. It was a total disaster.
A: Was it really that bad? Did they mention the budget thing?
B: Just stop asking. I'm trying to erase the last hour from my memory.
A: Alright, alright. I'll stop bugging you. Let's just grab a drink.
B: Best idea you've had all day. Let's go.

expression_477.example:
A: Did you hear that they're changing the office furniture again?
B: Honestly? I couldn't care less as long as I have a desk and a chair.
A: But they're getting those fancy standing desks everyone wanted!
B: Still don't care. I'm here to work, not to admire the decor.
A: You're so practical. I actually think it's kinda cool.
B: Good for you. Just let me know when they move my stuff.

similar: I was held up in traffic.
It was a parking lot out there.
expression_478.example:
A: You're finally here! We were about to start without you.
B: My bad, I got stuck in traffic on the BQE for like forty minutes.
A: That road is literally always a nightmare. I hate it.
B: For real. I should've just taken the train, it would've been way faster.
A: Well, you're here now. Let's get down to business.
B: Facts. I'm ready to go.

expression_479.primary: It's a different kettle of fish.
expression_479.example:
A: So if you can code in Python, you can definitely handle Java too, right?
B: Not really. It's a different kettle of fish entirely, man.
A: I thought they were both just coding languages, though.
B: The concepts are similar, but the syntax and rules are totally unique.
A: I see. So it's not as simple as I thought then.
B: Facts. I'm basically starting from square one with Java.
